alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Hill County; Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 2:57PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Blaine, eastern Hill and northeastern Chouteau Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 255 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from the Bear`s Paw Mountains northward to Havre. Movement was north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding and gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Havre, Chinook, Azure, Parker School, Beaver Creek, Agency, St. Pierre, Sangrey, Boneau, Rocky Boy, Lohman, Cleveland, Laredo and Lloyd. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
